text: Andrew Hope Davidson (1895-1967) was professor of midwifery at the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland. He was master of the Rotunda Hospital from 1933 to 1940.A Historical Perspective of the RCSI Department of Obstetrics and Gynaecology 1789-2006. RCSI Women's Health, 2006. Retrieved 24 February 2018. During the First World War he served with the Royal Army Medical Corps in Palestine and Syria. He was a foundation fellow of the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists.Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists. (2014) RCOG Roll of Active Service, 1914-1918. London: Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists. p. 3. title: Andrew Hope Davidson
